metadata.title: CVE-2019-19057 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Two memory leaks in the mwifiex_pcie_init_evt_ring() function indrivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/pcie.c in the Linux kernel through5.3.11 allow attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) bytriggering mwifiex_map_pci_memory() failures, aka CID-d10dcb615c8e.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19057` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-173-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1061-aws - 4.4.0-1061.65
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-azure - 4.15.0-1071.76~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1061.65').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.76~14.04.1').
